of ‘exynos_drm_ippnb_register’ was here

drivers/gpu/drm/exynos/exynos_drm_ipp.h:225:19: error: static declaration
of ‘exynos_drm_ippnb_unregister’ follows non-static declaration

drivers/gpu/drm/exynos/exynos_drm_drv.h:384:12: note: previous declaration
of ‘exynos_drm_ippnb_unregister’ was here

subject: mfd/rtc: s5m: Do not allocate RTC I2C dummy and regmap for unsupported chipsets
commitMessage:
mfd/rtc: s5m: Do not allocate RTC I2C dummy and regmap for unsupported chipsets

The rtc-s5m driver does not support all of S2M and S5M chipsets
supported by main MFD sec-core driver. For such chipsets unsupported by
rtc-s5m, the MFD sec-core driver initialized regmap with default config.
This config in such cases wouldn't work at all.

The main MFD sec-core driver shouldn't initialize regmap for child
drivers which is not used by them and even not valid.

Move the allocation of RTC I2C dummy device and initialization of RTC
regmap from main MFD sec-core driver to the rtc-s5m driver. The rtc-s5m
driver will use proper regmap config for supported devices.

Change-Id: Id158436deaed33ac2dafca06b818bd0518108084
Signed-off-by: Krzysztof Kozlowski <k.kozlowski@samsung.com>
Acked-by: Lee Jones <lee.jones@linaro.org>
Signed-off-by: Hyungwon Hwang <human.hwang@samsung.com>

subject: arm: dts: exynos4412: add cpu node
commitMessage:
arm: dts: exynos4412: add cpu node

This patch adds cpu node for Exynos4412. Because headsmp.S distinguish
a core by using the combination of cluster id and core id after the
commit 'add support secondary core bootup in big.LITTLE processor', but
when dt node for cpu is not provided, the core ids are assigned from 0
with the cluster id 0. But Exynos4412's cluster id for its 4 cores is
0xa. So this patch is needed for the cores to get the proper mpidr.

Change-Id: I2248fc332a4fbd05dc1983fcfa58f312e454c622
Signed-off-by: Hyungwon Hwang <human.hwang@samsung.com>

subject: clk: samsung: add new variable to compensate the gap for control register
commitMessage:
clk: samsung: add new variable to compensate the gap for control register

PLL35xx and PLL2550 are very similar, and so they share the code for
their control. PLL2550 in Exynos5422 have different offsets to control
register from the base of them. mainline linux have the variable for it.
But because of too much difference between the mainline linux and
Tizen 3.10. It cannot be adopted with few commits. So I made this patch
to accomplish this purpose with small changes.

Change-Id: Iae2192a62d9d9cc6fcd24fb009c7a41f89acb8f3
Signed-off-by: Hyungwon Hwang <human.hwang@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 3:

Yes. PLL2500 is right. According to mainline code, PLL2550 and PLL35xx share the code. I will add more comment about it.

exynos5420: add clock driver for exynos5420

This patch adds the clock driver of exynos5420. This driver is almost
same with the one in mainline linux kernel. There are too many commits
to this driver and the gap between exynos clock framework in Tizen 3.10
and Linux mainline 3.18 makes it hard and meaningless(in my opinion) to
get the original patches. So I modified only the interface between this
and the core of exynos clock framework to make it adoptable in Tizen
kernel 3.10.

Change-Id: I566d7b1fcbfcf84427276ac5246c4d81f094f0e7
Signed-off-by: Hyungwon Hwang <human.hwang@samsung.com>

subject: arm: tizen_defconfig: enable Odroid X2/U3 support with single kernel image
commitMessage:
arm: tizen_defconfig: enable Odroid X2/U3 support with single kernel image

Signed-off-by: Marek Szyprowski <m.szyprowski@samsung.com>
Change-Id: I92a8db74b9bcfcd55ae8d005f91ed52c844cf833

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

Not sure if this is intentional or not, but this patch seems to
disable early printks:

-CONFIG_EARLY_PRINTK=y

Except if not possible due to some weird Kconfig dependencies, I would keep it enabled, as it could be useful to detect boot problems.

Patch Set 1:

CONFIG_EARLY_PRINTK=y removal is intentional, it depends on CONFIG_DEBUG_LL, for which the UART debug port need to be selected in kernel configuration. Odroid and Trats2 used different UART ports so the single kernel image cannot be used on both board with this option enabled. You are right that earlyprintk is an useful feature, but if you are debugging serious boot issues you usually compile kernel by yourself, so it is not a problem to enable this option is such case.

subject: ASoC: odroidx2_max98090: Add odroidu3 headset jack detection support
commitMessage:
ASoC: odroidx2_max98090: Add odroidu3 headset jack detection support

This patch enables headset jack support for odroidu3 board in audio
machine driver, by creating a jack with the DAPM pins, Headset
Stereophone and Headset Mic, and to update according to jack status.
And pass this jack to max98090 codec driver for microphone detection
support, the actual jack detection is implemented in max98090 codec
driver by monitoring the jack interrupt status change and reporting
jack status through snd_soc_jack_report, even though this detection
has issue for now.

Change-Id: I9962ccb4d3e92a58d8df5f005a3f921e967981a8
Signed-off-by: Huang Chao <chao7.huang@samsung.com>

subject: ASoC: max98090: Refactor max98090_interrupt handler for jack detection
commitMessage:
ASoC: max98090: Refactor max98090_interrupt handler for jack detection

The max98090_interrupt handler currently will read the device status
register. After that, it will really acts only when the JDET bit is set.
However, when max98090_interrupt handler is triggered and jack status
register has really changed, but the JDET bit of device status register
is not set for unknown reason, so the jack status cannot be reported.

This patch adds a workaround solution for jack detection on odroidu3
board, by manually setting the JDET bit which indicates that the jack
status has just changed instantly.

Change-Id: I48ff1abb8a6553fab656c50fe1054bac8f398a4e
Signed-off-by: Huang Chao <chao7.huang@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

This should be just workaround but you did too much modification. Please implement simplely and don't modify original codes if possible.

Patch Set 4:

I have implemented by another way, withour modifying the original codes.

Patch Set 7:

Choose to use Mr. Shim's workaround code, and update commit messages.

subject: extcon: add extcon-odroid-usbotg driver
commitMessage:
extcon: add extcon-odroid-usbotg driver

This patch adds extcon driver for Odroid U3, U3+ and X boards.
It recognizes type of USB cable connected to Odroid board basing on
two signal lines VBUS_DET and OTG_ID (the second one is present only
on Odroid U3+ board).

Following table of states presents relationship between this signals
and detected cable type:

state    | VBUS_DET |  OTG_ID
-------------------------------
USB      |    H     |    H
invalid  |    H     |    L
disconn. |    L     |    H
USB-Host |    L     |    L

This driver is based on extcon-gpio driver.

Change-Id: I2694afd2eca7c9e1d030eb8637b87f9eaa5e9b2b
Signed-off-by: Łukasz Stelmach <l.stelmach@samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Robert Baldyga <r.baldyga@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 4:

This driver is odroid u3 and x2 specific. I think you reuse extcon-gpio driver(maybe it will support only one gpio) or you can make generic extcon driver to support matrix gpios.

Patch Set 4:

We also were thinking about extending gpio-extcon driver, but further research gave a bit more light on the problem. In case of OdroidU3+ there more logic needed than simple mapping gpio pins into cable values. This driver is also responsible of switching OTG VBUS power signal, like it is done in other extcon drivers (like MAX77693). To make things clear I will probably squash all the patches to extcon-odroid-usbotg driver into one to avoid confusion and resubmit to gerrit.

commitMessage:
extcon: extcon-odroid-usbotg: Add support for enabling USB Host power

subject: s5p-mfc: simplify the code format
commitMessage:
s5p-mfc: simplify the code format

Make the api s5p_mfc_queue_setup more simplified.

Change-Id: I40f70cf22b86633642fa907eca1181b8e3c164ca
Signed-off-by: panpan liu <panpan1.liu@samsung.com>

subject: Send process status in SCM_PROCINFO
commitMessage:
Send process status in SCM_PROCINFO

This introduces a new SCM type called SCM_PROCINFO to allow the direct
attaching of process status to SCM, which is significantly more
efficient and will reliably avoid the race with the round-trip over
procfs. This is optional and can be turned on by setting SO_PASSPROC.

To achieve that, new struct called unix_skb_parms_scm had to be created,
because otherwise unix_skb_parms would be too big.

This patch is reworked version of:
https://lkml.org/lkml/2014/1/13/40

Change-Id: Idb488f713a9382c217f8c7f4e358d7138ecbb8c9
Signed-off-by: Jan Kaluza <jkaluza@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Piotr Wilczek <p.wilczek@samsung.com>

subject: lib:proc_info:add library to get process information
commitMessage:
lib:proc_info:add library to get process information

This patch adds library to get process information without dependency
on CONFIG_PROC_FS. The new library code is moved from
fs/proc/array.c and fs/proc/task_(no)mmu.c. The functions are modified that
all process information can be retrived with a single process lock improving
performance.

Change-Id: I4d4b6a6710ad9f29d449d9a68424dfacb07c5d41
Signed-off-by: Piotr Wilczek <p.wilczek@samsung.com>
